key_facts: Four football fields of land turn into desert every second.
Nearly half of Earth’s land is at risk of desertification.
Dry regions critical to global agriculture are most vulnerable.
Climate change and extreme drought drive desertification.
Deforestation and unsustainable practices contribute to land degradation.
The UN aims to restore 1.5 billion hectares of land by 2030.
Projects like Africa’s Great Green Wall and efforts in Mongolia show progress.
Desertification threatens food security, biodiversity, and livelihoods.
Solutions include soil restoration, water conservation, and sustainable farming.
Worsening desertification could cause mass displacement and conflict.
